lyrics.lyrics: I remember when I first noticed that you liked me back
We were sitting down in a restaurant waiting for the check
We had made love earlier that day with no strings attached,
But I could tell that something had changed how you looked at
Me then
Kristen, come right back
I've been waiting for you to slip back in bed
When you light the candle
And on the Lower East Side you're dancing with me now
And I'm taking pictures of you with flowers on the wall
Think I like you best when you're dressed in black from head to toe
Think I like you best when you're just with me and no one else
Kristen, come right back
I've been waiting for you to slip back in bed
When you light the candle
And I'm kissing you lying in my room
Holding you until you fall asleep
And it's just as good as I knew it would be
Stay with me
I don't want you to leave...
Kristen, come right back
I've been waiting for you to slip back in bed
When you light the candle

lyricsAnnotations.lyrics:
Think I like you best when you’re dressed in black from head to toe
 Think I like you best when you’re just with me and no one else
annotation: Gonzalez may be conveying in this line that he likes when Kristen is modest and isn’t showing off because he wants her true colors to himself, and doesn’t want to share that with anyone else.  Given that this song is about a long-distance relationship where he reminisces about the time they spent together before she went away, we can assume he gets jealous at the idea that other people see and talk to her.

I think there’s huge symbolism to this line given its phrasing and how it closes the chorus. Candles symbolize bringing light from darkness.
When they are together, she brings some light and hope to him.

“A candle, in order to fulfill itself, must burn itself out. If a candle is never lit, it never fulfills its purpose”.  This also means there is loss to lighting, and therefore burning, a candle.

He knows he can’t have her for forever and that by being with her in any way, there is also an element of loss to the lightness and hope she brings. By being with her too in their current state, there is loss just by virtue that he doesn’t have her all to himself.

lyricsAnnotations.lyrics:
And on the Lower East Side, you’re dancing with me now
 And I’m taking pictures of you with flowers on the wall
annotation:
Here, the writer reminisces about his time with Kristen. This proves how much he misses her. He puts her on a ‘podium’ and frames all his good memories of her. He does this so he can preserve her although she is no longer with him.

“Pictures of you with flowers on the wall” may also be a play on words to “wallflowers” – a phrase describing shy people who prefer to observe than to actively participate, especially at dances.

sections.explanation: The first lyrics are sung, recalling the beginning of a special connection.
A description of meaningful past moments with the loved one.
A repetition of the chorus, emphasizing longing and closeness.
A tender and loving moment is described, reinforcing the emotional connection.
The final section reflects longing and intimacy in its reprise of the chorus.

song_start.explanation: The song begins with a calm and gentle introduction, setting a romantic and reflective mood.

song_end.explanation: The song concludes softly, leaving a lingering reflective tone.
